text.style: text-anchor: middle; font-family: Khand; font-size: 32.6783pt; fill: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke: rgb(136, 136, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: middle; font-family: Khand; font-size: 32.6783pt; fill: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke: rgb(136, 136, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: start; font-family: Slackside One; font-size: 31.0444px; fill: rgb(17, 68, 51); stroke: rgb(68, 204, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;

g.text: DEMENTATION: ●○○○○ - PassionSystem: The player rolls Charisma + Empathy (difficulty of thevictim’s Humanity score). The number of successes determines theduration of the altered state of feeling. Effects of this power mightinclude one- or two-point additions or subtractions to difficulties offrenzy rolls, Virtue rolls, rolls to resist Presence powers, etc.

text.style: text-anchor: start; font-family: Slackside One; font-size: 31.0444px; fill: rgb(17, 68, 51); stroke: rgb(68, 204, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;

g.text: AUSPEX: ●●●○○ - The Spirit'S TouchSystem: The player rolls Perception + Empathy. The difficulty isdetermined by the age of the impressions and the mental andspiritual strength of the person or event that left them. Sensinginformation from a pistol used for murder hours ago may require a 5,while learning who owned a set of keys found days ago might be a9. The greater the individual’s emotional connection to the object, thestronger the impression he leaves on it — and the more informationthe Kindred can glean from it. Also, events involving strongemotions (a gift-giving, a torture, a long fam ily history) likewiseleave stronger impressions than does short or casual contact. Assumethat each success offers one piece of information.

text.style: text-anchor: start; font-family: Slackside One; font-size: 31.0444px; fill: rgb(17, 68, 51); stroke: rgb(68, 204, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;

g.text: AUSPEX: ●●○○○ - Aura PerceptionSystem: The player rolls Perception + Empathy (difficulty 8); eachsuccess indicates how much of the subject’s aura the character seesand understands (see the table below). A botch indicates a false orerroneous interpretation. The Storyteller may wish to make this roll,thus keeping the player in the dark as to just how good (or bad) thecharacter’s interpretation is.

text.style: text-anchor: start; font-family: Slackside One; font-size: 31.0444px; fill: rgb(17, 68, 51); stroke: rgb(68, 204, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;

g.text: AUSPEX: ●○○○○ - Heightened SensesSystem: In certain circumstances, use of this power requires a dieroll: for a normal Perception roll (the Storyteller may reduce thedifficulty by the character’s Auspex rating), to notice a subject usingObfuscate (see p. 166), or to perceive a threat

text.style: text-anchor: middle; font-family: Khand; font-size: 32.6783pt; fill: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke: rgb(136, 136, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: start; font-family: Slackside One; font-size: 31.0444px; fill: rgb(17, 68, 51); stroke: rgb(68, 204, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;

text-anchor: end; font-family: Khand; font-size: 21.2409px; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(136, 136, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;

g.text: WaWWoD Cross+Over Sheet VTM20-2026.01.08 ©2026, Red Fox Studios.

text.style: text-anchor: end; font-family: Khand; font-size: 10.6205px; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(136, 136, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;

g.text: Red Fox Studios are a subsidiary of Pentex Inc. zaffarelli@gmail.com

text.style: text-anchor: end; font-family: Khand; font-size: 21.2409px; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(136, 136, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
